item.title: How The Outer Worlds 2 Can Include its Own Version of Avowed's Spells
item.description:
Summary

  • Avowed's spells received praise for their utility and fun factor, offering diverse options for builds and gameplay.
  • The Outer Worlds 2 could incorporate Avowed's spell system, possibly through experimental science weapons or gear attachments.
  • Despite being under Microsoft, The Outer Worlds 2 will launch on both PS5 and Xbox Game Pass, with more details to be revealed at the Xbox Games Showcase on June 8th.

The Outer Worlds 2 is Obsidian Entertainment's next highly awaited FPS RPG. The studio's most recent and similarly anticipated title , Avowed , was released this February, and the developer is set to treat fans to a double bill, as The Outer Worlds 2 is slated to arrive later this year. Avowed is based on the fantasy setting of Eora introduced in the preceding CRPGs, Pillars of Eternity , whereas The Outer Worlds 2 will see players once again navigate a darkly humorous retro future overrun by corporate greed and farcical dealings.

Avowed received a solid reception, and its approach to design resulted in a satisfying mix of combat, story, and exploration. This was especially true of the way it handled spells and related magical abilities, with a diverse range that all felt useful and impactful. And The Outer Worlds 2 has some great opportunities to replicate these.

Although Obsidian has been under Microsoft's banner since 2018, The Outer Worlds 2 will launch on PS5 concurrent with being a day one title on Xbox Game Pass. It does not have a firm release date yet.

The Outer Worlds 2 Could Make Great Use of Spells and Abilities Similar to Avowed's

Avowed's Spells Are One of its Standout Elements

Tons of fantasy RPGs include a range of spells and magical effects, and Avowed 's take on this standard worked to great success. Avowed 's spell system is fluid, effective, and (perhaps most importantly) fun. Further, since fans aren't locked into any traditionally specific classes like fighter or rogue, any build can make use of them, and there are a variety of ones that double as ways to manipulate the environment outside of combat to aid in puzzle solving or finding hidden high-quality items.

Items like wands and Avowed' s grimoires also allow players to experiment with the wide selection of spells to mix and match and find their preferred combinations. They can then upgrade those that they find most effective, and easily swap them out on the fly to react to any given situation. Obsidian's implementation of spells and related weapons in Avowed grants them both utility and visceralness that combine to create one of the best uses of such a system and mechanics in recent memory.

How The Outer Worlds Can Incorporate Abilities Like Avowed's Spells

Given the nature of The Outer Worlds ' futuristic sci-fi setting and its satirical flair, it has a couple of ways it could "steal" some of the spells featured in Avowed . Firstly, The Outer Worlds 2 could see the return of the wacky experimental science weapons like those from the first title and iterate upon them. These could essentially "shoot spells" that impart effects like those seen previously, along with other ones such as:

  • Elemental effects, e.g. ice/fire/acid/electricity
  • Gravity/time manipulation
  • Shrinking enemies
  • Mind control
  • Polymorphing
  • Summoning support

The Outer Worlds 2 could also lean into elements of the world like cybernetic enhancements, or dedicated skill trees and traits that allow players to take on strange mutations that could function more like BioShock 's plasmids.

Another way might be to have versions attached to specific or rarer gear. These might then be less powerful than their counterparts, or have some other drawbacks to equipping, but still allow players to access various spell-like abilities and effects. Whatever else Obsidian has in store for fans, though, it has given itself some excellent ways in Avowed 's spell system to build upon it and include some cool and fun possible options of a similar type in The Outer Worlds 2 .

The upcoming Xbox Games Showcase on June 8 will be followed by a new in-depth look at The Outer Worlds 2 which may reveal more of its combat design in this regard.

item.title: Stardew Valley Fan Shares Little-Known Furniture Detail
item.description:
Summary

  • Bountiful Dining Table in Stardew Valley changes meals when rotated.
  • Update 1.6 added hidden features like this table, surprising many players.
  • Stardew Valley continues to impress with hidden details, keeping the game fresh.

A Stardew Valley player has discovered a detail about the Bountiful Dining Table in the game that it seems few fans knew about. The detail adds to the versatility of the item, and is just one of the examples showing how much care goes into Stardew Valley .

Stardew Valley has seen content updates for years, and this particular item was added to the game with the long-awaited Stardew Valley 1.6 update. 1.6 added tons of new items to the game, as well as gameplay tweaks and quality of life improvements. While this particular decorative item has been appreciated since its addition, not everyone knew about this particular feature.

Over on Reddit, user Economy_Pride6360 expressed their surprise in a Stardew Valley community post at discovering that the Bountiful Dining Table changes when it's rotated, and asked if others knew. A brief video shared by them demonstrates the shift. When the table is placed horizontally, the table is decorated with food items like Spaghetti and Baked Fish. But when the table is rotated to sit vertically, the items change, with things like a Stardew Valley Lucky Lunch, Pink Cake, Pepper Poppers, and a Red Plate appearing instead.

Stardew Valley Players Surprised by Neat Furniture Detail

Numerous fans have shared their thoughts on the discovery, calling the find cool. Some didn't know that this table exists, which is understandable, since it's a fairly new addition to the game. Those who want one for themselves can grab the Bountiful Dining Table from the game's Furniture Catalogue , or they can try their luck with getting it from the Traveling Cart. Other fans were surprised that rotating furniture was even possible, while one fan noted that even with the built-in decorations, users can add a centerpiece meal on the table in either orientation.

Stardew Valley continues to delight players with discoveries like this one. There are plenty of reasons that gamers love the indie sim, but the bevy of hidden details and secrets in the game help to make the game feel fresh even for those who have been playing it for nearly a decade. It's not known if Stardew Valley will get another content update, but even if it doesn't, chances are fans will keep finding little details like this one for some time yet. After that, the Stardew Valley modding scene is so popular that the game will likely have enough fan content to keep it interesting for another decade or more.

item.title: 8 Best Multiplayer Games That Get Better As You Play
item.description:
Summary

  • Multiplayer games are often immediately fun & get better with time.
  • Games like Terraria offer diverse gameplay & scaling difficulty.
  • Titles like Dune: Spice Wars may have steep learning curves but offer deep strategic experiences.

It's often easier to find fun in games when playing with friends. A slow start can often be elevated when there's someone to share the experience with. As a result, multiplayer games can often be more immediately fun. However, some multiplayer games, even those that aren't as slow-burning, get better with time.

Some titles, such as Dune: Spice Wars , feature difficult onboarding processes and steep learning curves that slow the experience down. Others, such as Terraria , simply get more satisfying, more diverse as time goes on.

8 Terraria

Scaling Difficulty & Late-Game Bosses

Your comment has not been saved

Terraria
7 /10
16
9.4 /10
Released
May 16, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Blood and Gore, Cartoon Violence, Mild Suggestive Themes, Use of Alcohol
Powered by

Terraria is a co-operative survival-craft game that can be both a relaxing and engaging experience. This is thanks to its combination of creative base-building and challenging boss battles, offering players a dynamic ebb and flow of gameplay.

As players progress, Terraria opens up new areas, offers new items, and provides new challenges. Furthermore, the game's difficulty also scales as players progress, resulting in an experience that gets better as players advance. Furthermore, players naturally have access to better tools and a greater diversity of resources later in the game, granting them more freedom when base-building.

7 Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six Siege

A Diverse Tactical Shooter

Your comment has not been saved

Tom Clancy’s Rainbow Six Siege
10
8 /10
Released
December 1, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood, Drug Reference, Strong Language, Violence
Powered by

Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six Siege is a competitive tactical FPS that excels with its emphasis on teamwork, snappy gunplay, and a variety of classes. However, while the diverse abilities of its playable characters add variety to the experience, it can also make the game even more difficult for newcomers.

Knowing what each of the game's operators is capable of can be essential in reading any given situation, resulting in a less frustrating experience as players gain a better understanding of the roster. Map knowledge is also integral to success, making it easier for players to position themselves tactically and know where to look for potential targets.

6 Payday 2

Action & Stealth That Rewards Patience

Your comment has not been saved

Payday 2
8.3 /10
Released
August 13, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood, Drug Reference, Intense Violence, Strong Language, Suggestive Themes
Powered by

Payday 2 is a first-person shooter and stealth game that tasks players with pulling off dangerous, often high-stakes heists. By giving players freedom in how to approach each of its myriad missions, Payday 2 is able to provide a dynamic experience.

However, inexperienced and/or low-level players may not have much choice; attempting to complete a heist without breaking into a full-on gunfight can be a frustrating experience for those with little knowledge of the game. As a result, Payday 2 only gets better as players gain a better understanding of its missions and the possibilities within.

5 Streets Of Rogue

An Increasing Selection Of Unique Characters

Your comment has not been saved

Streets of Rogue
Action RPG
Systems
Released
March 10, 2017
ESRB
t
Developer(s)
Matt Dabrowski

Powered by

Streets of Rogue is an action-packed roguelite that tasks players with completing objectives in miniature sandbox environments. The game's immersive-sim influences add a great deal of freedom to the gameplay, facilitating creative problem-solving via myriad items and, most importantly, playable characters.

However, these playable characters must be unlocked. As a result, Streets Of Rogue becomes a more diverse and replayable experience as time goes on. Unlocking these characters is particularly rewarding as they are incredibly unique, each encouraging their own distinctive play-styles. Furthermore, the individuality of these characters ensures players can fulfill unique roles when playing in co-op.

4 Plants Vs Zombies: Garden Warfare 2

A Slew Of Zany Unlockable Characters

Your comment has not been saved

Plants vs. Zombies: Garden Warfare 2
8 /10
5 /10
Released
February 23, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ Due To Animated Blood, Crude Humor, Fantasy Violence
Powered by

Plants Vs Zombies: Garden Warfare 2 is a lighthearted third-person shooter that excels with its vibrant visuals and, most notably, its diverse ensemble of playable characters. Featuring asymmetric PvP multiplayer, Garden Warfare 2 allows players to battle foes as one of many unique classes on both sides.

The diversity of these classes is somewhat locked off to newcomers, as players are tasked with slowly unlocking new class variants as they progress. As a result, Garden Warfare 2 gets better with time, allowing players to enjoy a more diverse experience.

3 Ravenswatch

Dynamic Action & Strategic Exploration

Your comment has not been saved

Ravenswatch
Action
Adventure
Systems
Released
September 26, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
N/A
Powered by

Ravenswatch is an action roguelike that's clearly designed with co-op in mind, offering dynamic combat encounters and a diverse array of playable characters. However, this variety of playable characters is relatively limited at the start, resulting in a game that gets better as players progress.

Furthermore, the default difficulty setting in Ravenswatch is dramatically easier than its more challenging modes. With little challenge to begin with, Ravenswatch can be somewhat trivial early on, with decisions having little meaning. However, once players have unlocked harder difficulties and more characters, Ravenswatch becomes an intensely engaging experience. Players gain a greater diversity of choices after leveling up individual characters, resulting in a more strategic experience over time.

2 Dune: Spice Wars

A Slow-Burning Strategy Game

6 Images
6 Images

Your comment has not been saved

Dune: Spice Wars
Real-Time Strategy
Systems
Released
September 14, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
Teen // Fantasy Violence, Drug Reference
Powered by

Dune: Spice Wars combines the deep strategy of 4X titles with the expressive control and time pressure of real-time strategy games to great effect. What results is an experience that's slow-burning and yet urgent, offering a strategic sandbox of warfare, espionage, and politics.

Unfortunately, the abundance of unique resources and mechanics can make Dune: Spice Wars a difficult game to learn. As it's often overwhelming, newcomers may find little fun initially. However, those who take the time to learn the value of each resource, the intricacies of each faction, and the flow of an average skirmish are more likely to enjoy this title's melange of spicy mechanics.

1 StarCraft 2

Competitive Strategy That Requires Practice

Your comment has not been saved

StarCraft 2
8 /10
9.2 /10
Released
July 27, 2010

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Blood and Gore, Language, Suggestive Themes, Use of Alcohol and Tobacco, Violence
Powered by

Although StarCraft 2 features a single-player narrative to play through, more competitive players may find value in its versus mode. However, competing against players in StarCraft 2's multiplayer mode can be a challenging and often demanding experience that takes time and practice to succeed in.

This is thanks in large part to the speed and knowledge required; players need not only learn the units, buildings, and intricacies of each faction but the tried-and-true rules of engagement, the set standard that has developed over years of competitive play. As with any competitive game, StarCraft 2 requires practice and patience, but as players improve, the game becomes more expressive, allowing for creative thinking and clever strategies.

item.title: One Leaked Pokemon Legends: Z-A Mega Evolution Would Be a Major Series First
item.description:
Pokemon Legends: Z-A has been in the hot seat as leaks continue to emerge about potential new Mega Evolutions. While many of the leaked Pokemon receiving Megas in Pokemon Legends: Z-A are par for the course in predictions, one stands out as an unprecedented surprise for longtime fans.

Pokemon fans have been speculating about new Mega Evolutions that might appear in Legends: Z-A ever since the game’s first announcement trailer, and finally, some evidence may have emerged. A new list of possible new Mega Evolutions has leaked online, including some surprising choices. This list is unofficial and unconfirmed, so fans might be wise to be skeptical, as the last official announcement confirmed that Pokemon Legends: Z-A will receive a Switch 2 release, but didn’t confirm any Mega Evolutions. Among the list of Pokemon who might gain powerful new transformations are fan favorites like Dragonite, story-relevant Pokemon like the starter trio, and a few wildcards, such as Falinks. By far the most unusual suggestion, however, is that AZ’s Eternal Flower Floette might receive a mega form, becoming the only middle-stage evolution to receive one.

Why Eternal Flower Floette Deserves a Mega Evolution

Eternal Flower Floette is among the list of 27 leaked Mega Evolutions that are supposedly on the way in Pokemon Legends: Z-A , marking an unusual first for the series. Even taking into account the rest of the leaked list, Floette is the only middle-stage evolution Pokemon to be given the honor of a Mega Evolution. Even series mascot Pikachu never got a Mega form, seeming to cement the rule that only final-stage creatures are powerful enough to harness the energy required. The important distinction to be made, though, is that Eternal Flower Floette is the only Floette believed to be capable of Mega Evolution. In Pokemon X and Y , it is confirmed that AZ’s partner can’t evolve, just as AZ himself can’t age, so in a way, Eternal Flower Floette is in its final form. It is also believed to be much more powerful than a typical middle-stage Floette because of the energy it received from the ultimate weapon.

The Leaked Mega Evolutions Might Hint at What’s to Come

It’s no great leap of thought to conclude that, because Eternal Flower Floette can Mega Evolve, it will be used in a battle at some point in Pokemon Legends: Z-A . Some players have theorized that AZ might loan the player his powerful partner during the game, but it’s possible players might battle against him instead. Either way, the fact that this particular Pokemon could receive a Mega Evolution can help uncover what might happen in Legends: Z-A ’s story. Similarly, some believe that other leaked Mega Pokemon might replace ride Pokemon from Legends: Arceus .

New Mega Pokemon that might replace ride Pokemon include:

  • Mega Pyroar for faster movement
  • Mega Excadrill to find items
  • Mega Starmi for water traversal
  • Mega Barbaracle to climb
  • Mega Skarmory for flight

The confirmed return of AZ and his Floette already had players wondering what their role in the story might be, but the prospect of a Mega Eternal Flower Floette has made some reconsider their importance. It is confirmed that AZ now runs Hotel Z, where the player will stay during the game, but if these leaks are true, they might confirm that he is even more important than fans were led to believe. In X and Y , AZ was stated to be the former king of the Kalos region as well as an immortal giant. The new image he seems to have fostered doesn’t fit what most fans remember him as, but perhaps his laid-back hotel life is all a front.

If AZ and his powered-up Floette are brought into battle, it could even be one of the game’s most pivotal moments. This is just one way that Pokemon Legends: Z-A could use X and Y ’s untapped potential. The story of AZ and Eternal Flower Floette never received a satisfying conclusion back then, but they have another chance now. Pokemon Legends: Z-A marks a renewed chance for the pair, as well as a possible new appreciation for all 27 of the leaked Mega Pokemon.

item.title: 8 Single-Player Games With The Best In-Depth Character Creator
item.description:
When stepping into a solo experience, one of the best parts of any single-player game is the creation of a unique character that fits the player's personality, aesthetic or emulates a character from another piece of media. Creating an interesting-looking character is incredibly important as the player will be using that same face for most, if not all, of the playthrough, with a few exceptions allowing them to alter the appearance midway through. As time has gone on, the depth and level of customization available have only gotten better, along with graphical advancements that make each creation feel like a living and breathing person.

It isn't uncommon for players to spend a good amount of time perfecting each and every detail of their character's appearance, and there are plenty of games that offer nearly endless customization across a range of genres and kinds of games. From hairstyles, to facial features to body shapes and more, having the freedom to make any kind of character is a great feature to have in any game, and being able to traverse across diverse landscapes with an appearance of the player's choosing adds a level of depth that makes great single-player experiences into amazing ones.

8 Dragon's Dogma 2

Every Decision Counts Towards the Greatest Pawn

Your comment has not been saved

Dragon's Dogma 2
9 /10
14
6.8 /10
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 87 /100 Critics Rec: 91%
Released
March 22, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
Mature 17+ // Blood and Gore, Language, Sexual Themes, Violence
Developer(s)
Capcom
Platform(s)
PC, PS5, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
Powered by

When it comes to single-player RPGs, character customization has always been a standout feature when creating a compelling world that the player really feels a part of. Dragon's Dogma 2 sets a new high for the genre, delivering a system that is both richly details and deeply integrated into the game world. Players are given access to a robust character creator that allows for precise control over every aspect of their character's appearance, from skeletal structure and muscle mass to facial asymmetry, skin texture, and even voice pitch. What sets the game apart is that many of the choices made in the creation phase have real impacts on the game, which adds an extra level of immersion that is rarely seen elsewhere.

Simple things like height and weight can have a real impact on the ability to do certain things in the game, affecting movement speed, carrying weight, and more in extremely realistic ways. Another aid in the experience is the level of graphical quality found in the game. No more rigid polygons or strange-looking textures, each face and feature is photorealistic and allows the player to depict iconic celebrities and characters with some pretty close resemblance. In a genre with so many great character creators and a long list of standout titles, the freedom afforded in Dragon's Dogma 2 is among the best, really giving players the tools they need to create the hero of their dreams and embark on an unforgettable journey.

7 Elden Ring

Plenty of Sliders to Make Anything and Everyone

6 Images
6 Images

Your comment has not been saved

Elden Ring
10 /10
52
9.2 /10
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 95 /100 Critics Rec: 98%
Released
February 25, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Language, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Developer(s)
From Software
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series S, Xbox Series X
Powered by

FromSoftware has always been known for high-quality games that redefine what a good game should be and shatter expectations every time they release a new title. Within their games, the ability to customize how the player will look throughout the grueling adventures has always been a great way to start the journey, and a lot of players will spend a good amount of time getting every minute detail just the way they want it. The graphical fidelity might not be exceptional but the creations are certainly amazing, in Elden Ring , building on the foundations set by previous titles and letting players slide back and forth many sliders that dictate the size, length, and position of every possible facial feature to create realistic looking personalities as well as a few silly ones.

Something that is nice about the creation in Elden Ring is the simplicity. Everything is broken down into easy-to-understand segments, and if there is a specific facial feature the player is looking for, they will always find it organized neatly with the rest. While plenty of players will spend their time stretching out noses and forehead bones to the extreme, the tool is actually pretty sophisticated and gives a lot of agency on how the character will look through numerous specific tools and details that can be tailored to perfection. It is never going to be perfect, as many creators aren't, but the end results always deliver, no matter if the player is looking for a beautiful warrior or a face straight out of a horror movie.

6 Dragon Age: The Veilguard

Imagination is the Limit When it Comes to Creating a Hero

8 Images
8 Images

Your comment has not been saved

Dragon Age: The Veilguard
10 /10
135
7.3 /10
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 80 /100 Critics Rec: 71%
Released
October 31, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ // Blood, Nudity, Sexual Themes, Strong Language, Violence
Developer(s)
BioWare
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series S, Xbox Series X
Powered by

The character creation in Dragon Age: The Veilguard is more than just a study in visual design. It's a declaration of the player's identity in a world shaped by politics, culture, and personal legacy. Bioware continues its legacy of great character creators by giving players meaningful control over their protagonist's appearance and personality. Players choose from several races and backgrounds, each tied to distinct histories and social dynamics, and are then given an abundant list of tools that let them personalize their character with expansive and inclusive options. The decision of race is more important than just aesthetic, as different backgrounds and people will receive different treatment from characters in the world, which makes each decision not just aesthetic but deeply rooted in how the story unfolds.

On top of the appearance, Veilguard's customization stretches into combat and character development, as the class selection leads to tailored specializations and skill trees unique to that choice. Every decision is meaningful, aside from pink vs blue hair, which means that players can decide how to create their character not just on appearance alone but on how they want to be treated in the world and the impact they want to have on it. It is a great game to enjoy with a second character, as only then will the differences in selection truly become apparent and show the player the level of depth and variety possible in this exceptional single-player story.

5 Starfield

A Sprawling Galaxy Of Options

Your comment has not been saved

Starfield
10 /10
40
8.4 /10
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 85 /100 Critics Rec: 83%
Released
September 6, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood, Suggestive Themes, Use of Drugs, Strong Language, Violence
Developer(s)
Bethesda
Platform(s)
PC, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
Powered by

Starfield offers one of the most expansive character customization systems in recent single-player gaming, bringing Bethesda’s trademark RPG flexibility with a futuristic setting full of narrative depth that builds on all the best parts of the company's previous titles and delivers a new and exciting experience built from the ground up. From the outset, players are presented with an intuitive, layered character creator that allows for nuanced facial and body customization, including all the basics related to facial structure and appearance. But the standout feature lies in its background and trait systems. Players choose a starting background—like Bouncer, Diplomat, or Cyber Runner, that grants specific dialogue options, skill bonuses, and narrative flavor. These choices aren’t superficial or cosmetic either. They define who the player's character is in a sprawling galaxy of factions, ideologies, and moral gray areas.

Customization in Starfield continues to evolve as the player progresses. Skill trees unlock new abilities across categories like Tech, Combat, and Social, and the choices made reflect how the player interacts with the world, be it a stealthy smuggler, a charismatic trader, or an aggressive explorer. The initial creation is just wonderful, as rather than making a no-name character that is replaceable with any other, players truly feel as though they are creating a real space explorer with the capabilities and will to take on an entire galaxy alone. Despite being a solo experience, the world never feels empty, especially when considering the deep connection players gain with their character, with each interaction and piece of dialogue bridging the gap between fiction and reality.

4 Wo Long: Fallen Dynasty

More Than A Samurai Could Ever Need

Your comment has not been saved

Wo Long: Fallen Dynasty
8 /10
10 /10
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 81 /100 Critics Rec: 77%
Released
March 3, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
Rated M for Mature for Blood & Gore and Violence.
Developer(s)
Team Ninja
Platform(s)
PS5, PS4, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, PC
Powered by

Amid the surge of action RPGs influenced by Soulslike design, Wo Long: Fallen Dynasty distinguishes itself by pairing intense and rewarding combat with a thoughtfully constructed character customization system that feels like a whole game in itself. Rather than beginning with a predetermined warrior, the game opens with a comprehensive creation suite that supports a broad range of aesthetic and cultural expressions to fit any player's background and desires. The customization tool offers meticulous control over facial structure, body shape, skin tone, hairstyles, and adornments, ensuring that characters appear distinct and opening the door for more than a few insane creations from the world of pop culture.

One great feature of the game is the ability to share creations with any other player through codes. If the player is particularly proud of their creation, or really wants to play through the campaign looking like Harley Quinn, the system is there to allow players to freely use the creations crafted by some particularly skilled character makers. It really is one of the best character creators out there, and having it placed in a game of a similar calibre makes the whole experience elevated to a new level and truly immerses the player in the twisted world before them

3 The Sims 4

The Perfect Sandbox for a Virtual Life

Your comment has not been saved

The Sims 4
7 /10
41
8.4 /10
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 70 /100 Critics Rec: 26%
Released
September 2, 2014

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Crude Humor, Sexual Themes, Violence
Developer(s)
Maxis
Platform(s)
PS4, Xbox One, PC
Powered by

Character creation in gaming has one name that is particularly iconic and has continued to push the boundaries of immersion and depth. The Sims is practically the poster child for world simulation, and the ability to create entire families that emulate the real world with some exceptional accuracy is as fun as it is amazing. Every clothing item, body shape, and character depiction all made possible in a sandbox world of possibilities and excitement waiting to be experienced.

The limits are gone, and players have access to an insane library of downloadable extras and modding content that, when put together, can turn a simple character creator into a marathon of sliders, colors, and details that will make players forget about the actual game. The actual realism of each creation isn't as high as some other games, but the ability to dress and shape an individual to practically every specification imaginable makes The Sims 4 a standout achievement in the world of customization and one of the best places to build entire communities full of characters from the outside world as well as fiction.

2 Baldur's Gate 3

RPG Creation At Its Best

Few modern RPGs offer character customization as deeply interwoven with narrative, mechanics, and identity as Baldur’s Gate 3. Character creation begins with not only visual design but also with the selection of race, subrace, class, background, and Origin options, many of which are brought over from the DnD world and all of which significantly impact gameplay. Each choice affects dialogue, exploration, and how NPCs react in the sprawling world of Faerûn. The visual editor allows for intricate adjustments, presented with cinematic-quality detail. Even finer elements, such as eye color and skin sheen, are fully adjustable, contributing to a customization system that balances depth with usability. Importantly, the system also includes several options for non-binary players with a separation of voice, appearance, and gender identity, setting a high standard for inclusivity in character design.

Beyond initial creation, customization continues throughout the journey. Multiclassing, feats, gear choices, and spell selection allow for constant refinement of both aesthetics and function. Visual loadouts evolve with magical armor and enchanted weapons, yet players can tailor appearances through transmog systems and cosmetic options that maintain stylistic consistency and deliver a visual that is both combat-ready and looks great. Reactions from companions, faction dynamics, and role-playing scenarios are all influenced by earlier customization choices, reinforcing a dynamic sense of agency. In Baldur’s Gate 3 , customization isn’t isolated to a menu; it lives in every conversation, encounter, and decision, forming the backbone of a uniquely personal adventure shaped by deliberate, expressive design.

1 InZOI

The New Gold Standard

Powered by

The life simulation genre has been growing more than ever, and as technology advances, the ability to transport oneself into a digital world is becoming closer with every release. InZoi sets a new bar in terms of character creation, primarily through its striking commitment to realism and granular character customization. Thanks to the power of Unreal Engine 5, the game showcases photorealistic visuals that make character creation feel almost cinematic, with every creation made, looking more like a real-life model than a video game character. Hairstyles, makeup, accessories, and fashion choices draw from modern, culturally relevant aesthetics, giving the characters a grounded, contemporary look. The interface supports drag-and-pull editing, allowing for the intuitive sculpting of facial features with precision rarely seen in the genre. This focus on fidelity ensures that every character looks distinct and fits naturally into InZoi’s high-detail urban environments.

Beyond the visual editor, character customization plays a functional role in defining social interactions, lifestyle, and career paths, which makes each character not just look alive but feel it, too. Personal traits, ambitions, and personality archetypes influence how characters behave autonomously and how relationships develop over time. Everything is dynamic, but it might be hard to actually experience it, as there is enough content and enough tools in the creative part for a lifetime of creations. If players do manage to escape the industry-leading character creator, their creations will stand as more than just a simple individual. In InZoi, customization is not merely cosmetic; it’s foundational to storytelling, simulation depth, and emotional engagement, marking a bold evolution for life sims.
